Class DisjointSets<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • DisjointSets<T>

  • public class DisjointSets<T>
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DisjointSets(int HMAX)
      Is the constructor of this class which receives as parameter the maximum size of the array elements and of the list of buckets of the hasmap indexes.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addElement(T elem)
      This method receives as parameter an element(a word in our case) and based on it, it is made a new Entry object and it is added to the elements array and to the indexes hashmap with its set's index
      void mergeSetsOf(T e1, T e2)
      This method merges the sets of each element received as parameter based on their index as follows: every element which belongs to the set with the bigger index will be moved to the set with the smaller index; this move implies that the element and its new index will have to be put once again in the indexes hashmap in order to keep their new association.
      java.util.ArrayList<T> setOf(T elem)
      This method will return an array with all the elements that belong to the same set as the element given as parameter

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisjointSets

        public DisjointSets(int HMAX)
        Is the constructor of this class which receives as parameter the maximum size of the array elements and of the list of buckets of the hasmap indexes.
        Parameters:
        HMAX - represents the maximum size

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        public void addElement(T elem)
        This method receives as parameter an element(a word in our case) and based on it, it is made a new Entry object and it is added to the elements array and to the indexes hashmap with its set's index
        Parameters:
        elem - is the element(word in our case) to be added to the array elements and to the hashmap indexes

      • mergeSetsOf

        public void mergeSetsOf(T e1,
               T e2)
        This method merges the sets of each element received as parameter based on their index as follows: every element which belongs to the set with the bigger index will be moved to the set with the smaller index; this move implies that the element and its new index will have to be put once again in the indexes hashmap in order to keep their new association.
        Parameters:
        e1 - is one of the element which will merge its set with the other parameter's set
        e2 - is the other element which will merge its set with the other's set

      • setOf

        public java.util.ArrayList<T> setOf(T elem)
        This method will return an array with all the elements that belong to the same set as the element given as parameter
        Parameters:
        elem - is the element for which the method return its entire set
        Returns:
        an array which contains the set of the element given as parameter
